entry.title: starstruck
entry.summary:
Author: craycr4y

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,809Chapters: 2/6Kudos: 165

Summary: A loud bang shuts down Hal‚Äôs train of thoughts, his head swivels towards its direction, wondering if Batman had finally deigned to show up. But it wasn‚Äôt him. Instead, the person who shows up is decked out in red and blue; black lines stretch across his suit and meet at his chest to form a symbol of a‚Ä¶ spider? Huh. Did Batman change themes? or Spider-Man & Batman are best friends. No, the Justice League doesn't know that. And if you ask Bruce, they never should.Until they do.

entry.title: Clock strikes twelve.
entry.summary:
Author: Silly_Ody

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,695Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Bruce Wayne has to find a suitor, someone to marry. Living as he does, doing what he does ‚Äîbeing the bat, interferes with that. Can he truly trust someone with a secret as such? Clark Kent lived his whole life hiding who- no what, he truly is. Learning to hide his powers. Will he ever meet someone to truly understand what it is to keep a secret? A fire brings the bat to Luthor farms where he meets the most gorgeous ‚Äîand surprisingly strong‚Äî farmboy. Names were never exchanged, yet a whole year later that face has yet to leave his mind. One year after the incident, and with a little help from a magical force, Clark is able to go to the Prince, The Prince of Gotham‚Äôs gala and present himself as a possible suitor. But as the clock strikes twelve and the fantasy is over, Clark knows deep down Bruce would not like a farmboy like him, and deserves royalty. And decides to run away, deciding he was not fit for Bruce, accidentally losing his glasses in the process. (Based off of Cinderella :D)

entry.title: like grey skies (like a bird of paradise)
entry.summary:
Author: rainbow_nerds

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,394Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 87

Summary: He sighed to himself and downed the glass of champagne he'd been nursing‚Äînon-alcoholic, but enough to convince anyone who might give him a passing glance. He hated this, every time he had to do it. There was one surefire way to derail anyone who began wondering whether maybe Bruce Wayne was doing more than just donating funds to Batman.His tie hung loose around his neck, shirt unbuttoned to halfway down his chest, laughing too easily, pressing close to everyone he spoke to, whispering in ears, playing the part, until he turned and froze on the spot.Clark Kent, in his signature ill-fitting suit, stood holding a notebook and pen, staring at him with barely-concealed glee.Bruce cringed internally. He hated this. He especially hated when it had to be witnessed by someone he actually respected.or: After a Gala, Bruce and Clark end up in bed together. They're friends, just helping each other out, no strings attached. Which would be great, if Bruce hadn't been halfway to head-over-heels since the day they met.

entry.summary:
Author: battinscnz

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,137Chapters: 4/21Kudos: 27

Summary: Clark Kent is fresh out of college, beginning his first job at the Daily Planet, and doing his best to blend into the city around him. It would be simple enough - learning the ropes, chasing leads, keeping his head down - if he weren‚Äôt also quietly saving people in the shadows and trying to control abilities that don‚Äôt come with a manual. Metropolis whispers about a mysterious figure streaking through the night sky. They call him the Blur. Clark never intended to become anyone‚Äôs rumor. It happened anyway. Bruce Wayne arrives in the city chasing those rumors, determined to uncover the truth behind the impossible rescues and the flashes of color across the skyline. He expects a vigilante. He expects a secret. He doesn‚Äôt expect Clark. What begins as polite conversation turns to shared rooftop nights, lingering glances, and a slow pull neither of them planned. As Bruce edges closer to discovering Clark‚Äôs truth, he finds himself facing an even harder question:Is he here to unmask the Blur or is he coming back for the young reporter who keeps ruining his certainty?

entry.title: An Afternoon In Memory
entry.summary:
Author: blubbimafish

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,814Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 24

Summary: "My grandmother was born in the Ottoman Empire," Bruce said, without even turning to look at Clark. Though quiet, his sudden voice woke Clark further. He watched Bruce set the plate into the player and start the needle. The volume dial had been turned down some. Clark thought back to the european-history and middle-eastern politics courses he had taken in college. The Ottoman Empire had fallen sometime in the early 1920s after the First World War. Strange to consider that it was still in living memory for some. ‚Äî
